description: This course provides an introduction to the structure and creation of computer software,
using the C++ programming language and emphasizing object-oriented programming and
structured collaborative software-development methodology. Concepts and skills are
applied in a substantial multi-week team project. Topics include object-oriented programming,
specification, programmed memory management, indirect addressing, tools including team software
process, software design strategies, and elementary ethical analysis of software systems. Offered
each semester.  Prerequisite: CSCI 221 or permission of instructor.
